required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life in New Treatable Therapy as Rabeprazole Option for Refractory Reflux Esophagitis
clinical_study.official_title: Quality of Life in New Treatable Therapy as Rabeprazole Option for Refractory Reflux Esophagitis

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the efficacy and safety of PARIET twice daily (b.i.d.) in patients with Proton Pump Inhibitor-resistant reflux esophagitis

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with improvement based on health related Quality of Life (QOL) questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with improvement in symptoms of GERD

intervention.description: Doses of 10 mg or 20 mg twice daily may be administered orally to reflux esophagitis patients for a further 8 weeks when proton pump inhibitor treatment is ineffective. However, a dose of 20 mg twice daily should only be administered to patients with severe mucosa injury.

overall_official.affiliation: Drug Fostering and Evolution Coordination Department, Corporate Regulatory Compliance, Safety and Quality Assurance Headquarters, Eisai Co., Ltd.
